availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To the Sheriff of Mrcer County greeting
we Command you To Take H W Hironomous and & P B Thompson if he be found within your Bailiwick and him Safely keep so that you have his Body before the Judge of the Lincoln Circuit Court at the Rules to be held in the Clerks office of Said Court in the Town of Stanford on the fourth Mondy in august next To Satisfy the Commonwealth of Kentucky the Sum of $50000 for a fine imposed on him at the Term on Replevin Bond
allso the Sum of $210 which was adjudged To the said Commonwealth aforsaid for her cart in that Behalf eppended and have then there this writ

witness -- S. S. McRoberts
Clerk of our said court this 9th June 1865

the the above is a True Copy of Recogs in my hands vs H W Hironomous
aug 14th 1865

Lincoln Cir Ct
vs
H. W. Hieronymous
forfeiture
Replevin by P. B Thompson
$500
Remitted 22d Aug /65
